comments.content: CCNP shouldn't be memorisation of Cisco sales pitches..save that for Azure exams lol.

questions.question_text: Which are the three focus areas for reinventing the WAN? (Choose three.)

An engineer is tasked with designing a dual BGP peering solution with a service provider. The design must meet these conditions:
* The routers will not learn any prefix with a subnet mask greater than /24.
* The routers will determine the routes to include in the routing table based on the length of the mask alone.
* The routers will make this selection regardless of the service provider configuration.
Which solution should the engineer include in the design?

choices.A: Use a route map and access list to block the desired networks, and apply the route map to BGP neighbors inbound.
choices.C: Use an IP prefix list to block the desired networks and apply the IP prefix list to BGP neighbors outbound.
choices.B: Use a route map and prefix list to block the desired networks, and apply the route map to BGP neighbors outbound.
choices.D: Use an IP prefix list to block the desired networks and apply the IP prefix list to BGP neighbors inbound.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Use an IP prefix list to block the desired networks and apply the IP prefix list to BGP neighbors inbound.

To meet the design conditions, the engineer should create an IP prefix list that blocks prefixes with a subnet mask greater than /24, and apply the IP prefix list to BGP neighbors inbound. This will filter out undesired networks and ensure that the routers will only learn prefixes with a subnet mask of /24 or less. This selection will be made based on the length of the mask alone, and it will be independent of the service provider's configuration.

Selected Answer: D
Provided Answer is correct

* The routers will determine the routes to include in the routing table based on the length of the mask alone. ==> prefix list == length of mask alone , otherwise route-map is always more versatile

Selected Answer: CD
going with C and D on this one, but agreed that the question is stupid

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true regarding SD-WAN demonstrations? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Use demonstrations primarily for large opportunities and competitive situations
choices.D: During a demo, you should demonstrate and discuss what the team considers important details
choices.A: As a Cisco SD-WAN SE you should you should spend your time learning about the technology rather than contributing to demo innovation.
choices.E: There is a big difference between demos that use a top down approach and demos that use a bottom up approach
choices.C: During a demo, you should consider the target audience and the desired outcome

choices.D: ISE supports up to 100 Policy Services Nodes
choices.A: The number of logs that ISE can retain is determined by your disk space
choices.F: In distributed deployments, failover from primary to secondary Policy Administration Nodes happens automatically
choices.C: In two-node standalone ISE deployments, failover must be done manually
choices.E: ISE can detected endpoints whose addresses have been translated via NAT

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
a think is A&E
